Hey,

One thing that is a frequent issue with our students using junit on
t=
he testing server: junit captures std[out/err] and stores it in a
memory-ba=
cked buffer. When students put too much debugging code, the
junit process w=
ill completely die. I'm wondering if it'd be rational
to put some sort of l=
imit on the size of the buffer used (maybe via a
system property).

-- Ben
=
